text: When you take into account

the most searched term on PornHub
for the past two years,
by men and women alike, was "lesbian"...
you gotta be thinking,

"Damn! That’s a lot of
lesbians and lesbian allies."
Wrong.
Lesbian porn is not for lesbians.

More often than not,
lesbian porn is created by men,

for men and involves
two very straight chicks
pretending to be into boobs.
Lesbian trade secret:

Lesbian porn is not two straight
femmed-out chicks with long acrylic nails.
This point about acrylic nails may seem like a tangent
but the length of a woman’s nails can literally be a factor you use
to determine if a woman’s queer.
Because,
you know, ouch.
One-inch diamante nails are a cogent reminder
that lesbian porn is performance created by men
to fulfill a male fantasy.
And when you consider that over half of young men
and around a third of young women
were exposed to porn before the age of 12,
it’s clear that porn has become a key form of sex ed.

So spreading a representation
of lesbianism created for the male gaze
not only misinforms, but also cheapens it
by reducing it to a male-driven fetish,
rather than a powerful expression of female sexuality.
One free from men.

And speaking personally,
this misrepresentation sucks.

I’m obviously into Netflix and chillin’
with a hot lady as much as the next guy.

But not when she doesn’t know
that lesbian sex is creative

and fluid and very often demands
an expression of sexual predilections
and desires that straight sex does not.
Almost by definition, lesbian sex
doesn’t allow you to be lazy or conventional.

It’s also the only kind of sex
that demands female fulfillment,
another thing very often overlooked in porn
and society.

And it’s important to be creating
realistic depictions
of women having sex with each other,
because failing to do so continues the cycle

of viewing lesbianism through
an often-misogynistic and male lens.

Right now, the status quo
undermines my own identity,

along with an entire subset
of the population.

When I’m told by a guy at a bar
that I haven’t had sex

with the right dude or
I haven’t had the right D,
when I’m harassed by men on the street
because I’m kissing my girlfriend goodbye,
when I’m told that lesbian sex isn’t real sex,
it’s degrading.

And it immediately relegates
lesbians and queer women
to second-class citizenship.
So lezbi better
about what lesbian sex is:
Awesome!
And not for dudes.
